question:
With regards to the recent decision to introduce significant changes into what constitutes a ‘related party transaction’, consider the following statements:
  1. An entity holding over 20% of the holdings is considered a related party.
  2. An entity indirectly holding a large enough stake would still not be considered as related party.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The SEBI had appointed a panel to strengthen the norms regulating related party transactions. One of the proposals by the panel is to define any entity or person holding 20% or more of the listed entity’s holdings to be considered as related party. Statement 2 is incorrect:   An entity holding a large enough stake (20% or more) of the holding- either directly or indirectly- is to be considered as related party. SEBI had formed the panel under the chairmanship of Ramesh Srinivasan in November, 2019 to review the RPT policies.
